metadata.titleEn: HiWATER: Dataset of hydrometeorological observation network (No.5 runoff observation system of Ban bridge on the Heihe River, 2013)
metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：水文气象观测网数据集（5号点-板桥径流观测数据-2013）
metadata.description:
The No. 5 hydrological section is located at Ban Bridge (100.276° E, 39.259° N, 1398 m) in the midstream of the Heihe River Basin, Zhangye city, Gansu Province. The dataset contains observations recorded by the No.5 hydrological section from 19 June, 2012, to 10 August, 2012. The width of this section is 270 meters. The water level was measured using an HOBO pressure range and the discharge was measured using cross-section reconnaissance by the StreamPro ADCP. The dataset includes the following parameters: water level (recorded every 30 minutes) and discharge. The missing and incorrect (outside the normal range) data were replaced with -6999.
For more information, please refer to Li et al. (2013) (for hydrometeorological observation network or sites information), He et al. (2016) (for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2012年6月19日至8月10日，2012年11月24日至2013年12月31日的黑河中游径流加密观测中5号点的河流水位和流速观测数据。观测点位于甘肃省张掖市临泽县板桥乡黑河桥，河床为砂砾石，断面不稳定。观测点的经纬度是N39°15'32.41"，E100°16'33.95"，海拔1398米，河道宽度270米。水位观测采用HOBO压力式水位计，采集频率30分钟。数据说明包括以下两部分：
水位的观测频率30分钟，单位（cm）；数据涵盖时间段2012年6月19日-2012年8月10日，2012年11月24日-2013年12月31日；流量观测，单位（m3）；按照不同水位监测流量，获取水位流量曲线，依托水位过程观测获得径流量变化过程。缺值数据统一采用字符串-6999表示。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考He et al.(2016)。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的阻碍。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而解决这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度协方差（EC）塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次航空遥感任务，使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖了FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域被先前的研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，并支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

background: 全球气候变暖对降水的影响，就中国而言西部 (大约以 103°E 为界) 近 30 年来该区域年降水量表现出普遍增加的趋势。作为水文和气候研究的重点区域，青藏高原由于地形、地势的复杂变化导致降水时空分布的极端复杂性，同时因为降水观测点分布及人工观测局限性等原因使得降水资料的代表性一直是相关研究的薄弱环节。另一方面，对于气候寒冷的青藏高原地区，固态降水所造成的观测误差对降水量的观测影响尤为强烈。因此，青藏高原的降水观测是一个亟待解决的现实问题。
research objective: 因此，针对这一情况本文对青藏高原中部唐古拉山地区的降水观测进行了对比分析和修正。
challenges: 因为降水观测点分布及人工观测局限性等原因使得降水资料的代表性一直是相关研究的薄弱环节。对于气候寒冷的青藏高原地区，固态降水所造成的观测误差对降水量的观测影响尤为强烈。
methods: 2005 年 5 ～ 10 月在青藏高原唐古拉山中部冬克玛底河流域进行连续的人工气象观测。观测期间根据不同降水类型和气温之间的相关关系，采用气温 2.7℃ 为临界值对降水类型进行了划分，利用已有的 T-200B 型自动雨雪量计和普通雨量计的修正公式，并在日尺度基础上对降水进行了修正对比。在降水类型判断的基础上，采用式 (3) 和实测风速，对 T-200B 自动雨量计进行修正，以此得到较为贴近实际的降水量。
findings: 修正结果显示 T-200B 型自动雨雪量计降水总积累量提高到 DFIR 的 87％，远远高于未修正时的 36％，效果明显。利用气温划分降水类型所得修正降水量值相对雨量计原始观测值提高约 16.8％，而根据实际观测的降水类型计算所得的降水量值较原始观测值提高 17.7％。利用划分降水类型的温度指标修正 T-200B 型自动雨雪量计的降水量观测值完全可以适应高原恶劣的自然环境，并对降水进行长期自动的观测。相较于 1993 年观测所得的降水量，在相同地点观测修正后的年降水量 662.1 mm 远大于当时的全年降水量 472 mm。
backgroundCn: 全球气候变暖对降水的影响，就中国而言，西部（大约以103°E为界）近30年来该区域年降水量表现出普遍增加的趋势。作为水文和气候研究的重点区域，青藏高原由于地形、地势的复杂变化导致降水时空分布的极端复杂性，同时因为降水观测点分布及人工观测局限性等原因使得降水资料的代表性一直是相关研究的薄弱环节。另一方面，对于气候寒冷的青藏高原地区，固态降水所造成的观测误差对降水量的观测影响尤为强烈。因此，青藏高原的降水观测是一个亟待解决的现实问题。
research objectiveCn: Therefore, this article conducts a comparative analysis and correction of precipitation observations in the central Tanggula Mountains region of the Tibetan Plateau in response to this situation.
challengesCn: 由于降水观测点分布及人工观测局限性等原因，降水资料的代表性一直是相关研究的薄弱环节。对于气候寒冷的青藏高原地区，固态降水所造成的观测误差对降水量的观测影响尤为强烈。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of how data processing and quality control are implemented in hydrometeorological datasets?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个关于如何在水文气象数据集中实施数据处理和质量控制的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of data processing and quality control in hydrometeorological datasets includes the careful calibration of sensors, systematic data collection, processing steps like data validation and correction, and the generation of datasets for sharing, as illustrated in the collection of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data in oasis-desert areas.
Example.AnswerCn: 在水文气象数据集中，数据处理和质量控制的一个例子包括对传感器的仔细校准、系统的数据收集、数据验证和修正等处理步骤，以及生成用于共享的数据集，正如在绿洲-沙漠地区收集能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据所示。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the specific attributes of hydrometeorological data collected in oasis-desert systems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集的水文气象数据的具体属性是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, soil moisture profiles
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水、土壤湿度剖面

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the typical challenges faced in collecting precipitation data in regions like the Tibetan Plateau?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在像青藏高原这样的地区收集降水数据通常面临哪些挑战？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: complex spatiotemporal distribution, strong observational errors, limited distribution of observation points, inherent limitations of manual observation
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 复杂的时空分布、强烈的观测误差、有限的观测点分布、手动观测的固有局限性

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What types of instruments are used in capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous surfaces?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 用于捕捉异质表面中多尺度生态水文过程的仪器类型有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, eco-hydrological sensor networks for soil moisture and leaf area index, hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing tools, LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, L-band microwave radiometers
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 涡度相关塔的通量观测矩阵、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站、用于土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络、高分辨率机载遥感工具、LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪、L波段微波辐射计。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is a multiscale dataset, and why is it important in eco-hydrological research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 多尺度数据集是什么，它在生态水文研究中为什么重要？
Definition.AnswerEn: A multiscale dataset is a collection of data obtained from various hierarchically nested scales, capturing diverse eco-hydrological processes. It is important in eco-hydrological research because it provides comprehensive, multi-disciplinary data that addresses the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations, facilitating a better understanding of complex interactions in heterogeneous landscapes.
Definition.AnswerCn: 多尺度数据集是从各种层次嵌套尺度中获得的数据集合，捕捉了多样的生态水文过程。它在生态水文研究中非常重要，因为它提供了全面的多学科数据，解决了多尺度观测稀缺的挑战，促进了对异质景观中复杂相互作用的更好理解。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the challenges associated with hydrometeorological data collection in arid and semiarid regions?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区收集水文气象数据面临哪些挑战？
Definition.AnswerEn: Challenges associated with hydrometeorological data collection in arid and semiarid regions include ecological environment degradation, drying up of water sources, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, which complicate the acquisition and accuracy of long-term observational data.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，水文气象数据收集面临的挑战包括生态环境退化、水源枯竭、自然植被退化、沙漠化加剧以及频繁发生的沙尘暴，这些因素使得长期观测数据的获取和准确性变得复杂。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of using automated instruments like the HOBO pressure water level meter in hydrological data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在水文数据收集中使用像HOBO压力水位计这样的自动化仪器有什么意义？
Definition.AnswerEn: The use of automated instruments like the HOBO pressure water level meter in hydrological data collection is significant because they provide consistent, high-frequency observations of water levels, which are crucial for developing water level-flow curves and understanding runoff changes over time, especially in dynamic environments like riverbeds with unstable cross-sections.
Definition.AnswerCn: 使用自动仪器，如HOBO压力水位计，在水文数据收集中的重要性在于它们提供了一致的、高频率的水位观测，这对于开发水位-流量曲线和理解流域变化，尤其是在河床等不稳定横截面的动态环境中，至关重要。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods used in the Heihe Watershed experiment compare to those used in the artificial and natural oasis–desert systems in terms of capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域实验中使用的数据收集方法与人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统中使用的方法相比，在捕捉多尺度生态水文过程方面有什么不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The Heihe Watershed experiment utilizes a hierarchically nested scale system with instruments like eddy covariance towers and remote sensing tools to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes. In contrast, the datasets from oasis–desert systems focus on long-term data collection of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers, supplemented with hydrometeorological and vegetation data.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 黑河流域实验利用分层嵌套的尺度系统，使用涡度协方差塔和遥感工具捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。相比之下，绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集侧重于长期收集能量、水汽和碳通量的数据，使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪，辅以水文气象和植被数据。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges of data collection in arid regions differ from those in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, particularly concerning precipitation observations?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，数据收集的挑战与青藏高原的挑战在降水观测方面有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Data collection in arid regions faces challenges such as ecological environment degradation and the need for long-term observations to maintain oasis-desert balance. In the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, challenges include the extreme complexity of precipitation spatial distribution due to topography and the significant impact of solid precipitation on observation accuracy.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，数据收集面临生态环境退化和需要长期观察以维持绿洲-沙漠平衡等挑战。在青藏高原，挑战包括由于地形造成的降水空间分布极其复杂，以及固态降水对观测准确性的显著影响。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the integration of various remote sensing technologies enhance the understanding of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 各种遥感技术的整合如何增强对绿洲-沙漠系统中生态水文过程的理解？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The use of remote sensing technologies such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers, as part of a hierarchically nested observation system, allows researchers to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes. This integration provides comprehensive data that supports the investigation of interactions in oasis-desert systems, thereby facilitating better understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 遥感技术的使用，如激光雷达（LiDAR）、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，作为一个分层嵌套的观测系统的一部分，使研究人员能够捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程。这种整合提供了全面的数据，支持对绿洲-沙漠系统中相互作用的研究，从而促进对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的更好理解。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What are the challenges in maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems, and how do observational datasets contribute to addressing these challenges?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡时面临哪些挑战，观测数据集如何有助于解决这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges include ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers, land desertification, and dust storms. Observational datasets, which include long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes as well as hydrometeorological data, offer critical insights into the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes. This quantitative understanding is vital for achieving sustainable oasis development and supporting ecological security.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 挑战包括生态环境退化，例如河流干涸、土地沙漠化和沙尘暴。观测数据集，包括长期的能量、水蒸气和碳通量以及水文气象数据，提供了对能量、水蒸气和碳交换过程的重要见解。这种定量理解对于实现可持续的绿洲发展和支持生态安全至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What methodological considerations are essential for improving the accuracy of precipitation observation in complex high-altitude regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在复杂的高海拔地区，提高降水观测准确性所需的关键方法论考虑因素有哪些？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: In high-altitude regions like the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, challenges such as the distribution of observation points and solid precipitation measurement errors necessitate methodological improvements. By using temperature as a criterion to classify precipitation types and applying corrections to automated precipitation gauges, researchers can achieve more accurate precipitation measurements. This approach adapts to the harsh natural environment and supports long-term automated observation.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在高海拔地区如青藏高原，观测点分布和固体降水测量误差等挑战需要方法上的改进。通过使用温度作为分类降水类型的标准，并对自动降水计进行修正，研究人员可以实现更准确的降水测量。这种方法适应恶劣的自然环境，并支持长期的自动观测。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges of obtaining multiscale observations in eco-hydrological processes within heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在异质表面中获取生态水文过程的多尺度观测所面临的挑战的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations, which is a significant challenge in understanding eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces. The HiWATER experiment addresses this challenge by using instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的制约，这是理解异质表面生态水文过程的一个重大挑战。HiWATER实验通过在分层嵌套的尺度上使用仪器，获取多尺度和多学科的数据，以应对这一挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the significant observational errors in precipitation data collection in the Tibetan Plateau, and how can these errors be addressed?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致青藏高原降水数据收集显著观测误差的原因是什么？如何解决这些误差？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Observational errors in precipitation data collection in the Tibetan Plateau are primarily due to the region's complex terrain and the limitations in the distribution of observation points. Additionally, solid precipitation leads to significant errors in measurement. These issues can be addressed by using temperature as a criterion for classifying precipitation types and employing correction formulas for existing instruments, such as the T-200B automatic rain gauge, to improve the accuracy of observed precipitation data.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在青藏高原，降水数据收集中的观测误差主要由于该地区复杂的地形和观测点分布的局限性。此外，固体降水会导致显著的测量误差。这些问题可以通过使用温度作为分类降水类型的标准，以及采用修正公式对现有仪器（如T-200B自动雨量计）进行校正，以提高观测降水数据的准确性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential effects of implementing multiscale observation networks on understanding oasis-desert interactions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 实施多尺度观测网络对理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing multiscale observation networks can significantly enhance the understanding of oasis-desert interactions by capturing eco-hydrological processes at various scales. This approach can provide detailed insights into energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, which are crucial for maintaining ecological stability and supporting socioeconomic development in these regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 实施多尺度观测网络可以显著增强对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解，通过在不同尺度上捕捉生态水文过程。这种方法可以提供关于能量、水蒸气和碳交换的详细见解，这对于维持这些地区的生态稳定性和支持社会经济发展至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary objective of creating a multiscale dataset in the context of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统的生态水文过程背景下，创建多尺度数据集的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objective is to address the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface, which is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. The dataset aims to capture these processes through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, facilitating a better understanding of oasis-desert interactions and supporting ecological security and sustainable development.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是解决在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的挑战，这一挑战受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。该数据集旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器测量，捕捉这些过程，从而更好地理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用，并支持生态安全和可持续发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to have a network of hydrometeorological and flux observation stations in arid and semiarid regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区建立水文气象和通量观测站网络的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is crucial to maintain a network of observation stations in these regions to quantitatively understand the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange. This understanding is essential for recognizing the interactions between oasis and desert systems, thus supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development. Such a network provides long-term data necessary to achieve sustainable oasis development goals and carbon neutrality.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 在这些地区维护观测站网络至关重要，以定量了解能量、水汽和碳的交换。这种理解对于认识绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用至关重要，从而支持生态稳定和社会经济发展。这样的网络提供了实现可持续绿洲发展目标和碳中和所需的长期数据。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the goals behind implementing intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations in the HiWATER experiment?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在HiWATER实验中实施强化观测期（IOPs）和连续水文气象观测的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data to address the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations. By implementing IOPs and continuous observations, the HiWATER experiment aims to gain insights into the eco-hydrological processes and interactions within the oasis-desert system, thereby advancing the field's understanding and facilitating better management and development strategies in arid regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是获取多尺度和多学科的数据，以应对多尺度观测稀缺的挑战。通过实施集成观测（IOPs）和持续观测，HiWATER实验旨在深入了解绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态水文过程和相互作用，从而推动该领域的理解，并促进干旱地区更好的管理和发展策略。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the procedures involved in using HOBO pressure water level sensors for river stage measurements, and how is the data frequency managed?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 使用HOBO压力水位传感器进行河流水位测量的程序包括哪些步骤，以及数据频率是如何管理的？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: HOBO pressure water level sensors are used to measure river stage at a frequency of 30 minutes. The data collected includes river water levels and flow velocities, which are then used to derive a stage-discharge curve. Missing data are indicated by the string -6999. The data is collected continuously over specified periods to monitor changes in runoff.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: HOBO压力水位传感器用于以30分钟的频率测量河流水位。收集的数据包括河流水位和流速，然后用于推导水位-流量曲线。缺失的数据用字符串-6999表示。数据持续收集于指定的时间段，以监测径流变化。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are multiscale eco-hydrological processes captured and integrated using hierarchically nested observation systems, and what types of instruments are typically involved?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 多尺度生态水文过程是如何通过分层嵌套观测系统捕捉和整合的，通常涉及哪些类型的仪器？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Multiscale eco-hydrological processes are captured using a hierarchically nested observation system that includes eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and an eco-hydrological sensor network. The instruments are arranged to capture data across different scales, including airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers, to investigate oasis-desert interactions.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 多尺度生态水文过程通过一个分层嵌套的观测系统进行捕捉，该系统包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站和生态水文传感器网络。这些仪器的布置旨在捕获不同尺度的数据，包括使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的航空遥感，以研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the steps involved in processing and quality controlling long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon flux datasets collected from oasis-desert systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 从绿洲-沙漠系统收集的长期能量、水汽和碳通量数据集的处理和质量控制步骤是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The processing and quality control of long-term datasets involve several steps, including data collection, processing, and archiving. Data is collected from instruments like eddy covariance systems and scintillometers, with hydrometeorological parameters also recorded. The datasets include energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, as well as vegetation and soil parameters, all of which undergo quality control to ensure accuracy before being shared with data centers.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 长期数据集的处理和质量控制涉及多个步骤，包括数据收集、处理和归档。数据来自涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪等仪器，同时记录水文气象参数。这些数据集包括能量、水蒸气和碳通量，以及植被和土壤参数，所有这些数据在共享给数据中心之前都经过质量控制，以确保准确性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements enable the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在异质景观中收集多尺度生态水文数据成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of hierarchically nested instrumentation, including eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing technologies such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer, allows for the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in heterogeneous landscapes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 层次嵌套的仪器使用，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站以及超高分辨率的航空遥感技术，如激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，使得在异质景观中收集多尺度生态水文数据成为可能。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do observational networks enhance the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 观测网络如何增强对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的理解？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Observational networks, consisting of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon fluxes, and auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, enable a quantitative understanding of the oasis-desert interactions, which is critical for maintaining ecological stability and supporting sustainable development in these ecosystems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 观测网络由长期的能量、水汽、碳通量以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据组成，这些网络使我们能够定量理解绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用，这对于维持生态稳定性和支持这些生态系统的可持续发展至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the availability of multiscale observations be challenging in eco-hydrological research, and how can data collection methods be improved to address these challenges?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么多尺度观测的可用性在生态水文研究中可能具有挑战性，如何改进数据收集方法以应对这些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Progress in the field of eco-hydrological research is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. To address these challenges, HiWATER implemented an observation system with hierarchically nested scales and conducted intensive observation periods, using a combination of eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing. Improving data collection could involve expanding the network of these instruments and ensuring continuous, long-term observations to capture the complex interactions in such ecosystems.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 生态水文学研究领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。为了解决这些挑战，HiWATER实施了一个具有层次嵌套尺度的观测系统，并进行了密集观测期，使用了涡度协方差塔、自动气象站和超高分辨率航空遥感的组合。改善数据收集可以包括扩展这些仪器的网络，并确保持续的长期观测，以捕捉这些生态系统中复杂的相互作用。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected challenges in obtaining reliable precipitation data in regions like the Tibetan Plateau, and how can data collection methods be adapted to overcome these challenges?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在像青藏高原这样的地区获取可靠的降水数据面临哪些预期挑战，以及如何调整数据收集方法以克服这些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: In regions like the Tibetan Plateau, the distribution of observation points and limitations in manual observations make it challenging to obtain representative precipitation data. The use of automatic rain gauges, like the T-200B, can improve data accuracy by adjusting for solid precipitation errors. Employing temperature-based criteria to classify precipitation types and correcting measurements accordingly can also enhance the reliability of long-term automated observations in such harsh environments.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在像青藏高原这样的地区，观测点的分布和人工观测的局限性使得获取代表性的降水数据变得具有挑战性。使用自动雨量计，如T-200B，可以通过调整固体降水误差来提高数据的准确性。采用基于温度的标准来分类降水类型，并相应地修正测量结果，也可以增强在这种恶劣环境中长期自动观测的可靠性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems, and what datasets or data collection methods could support this objective?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要，原因是什么？哪些数据集或数据收集方法可以支持这一目标？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Maintaining a balance between oasis and desert systems is crucial for sustainable development and ecological stability. Datasets that capture long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, along with auxiliary hydrometeorological and vegetation data, are vital. Data collection methods should include a combination of eddy covariance systems, automatic weather stations, and ground-based observations to provide comprehensive insights into these complex interactions and support ecological security and socioeconomic development.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡对可持续发展和生态稳定至关重要。捕捉长期能量、水汽和碳交换的数据集，以及辅助的水文气象和植被数据是必不可少的。数据收集方法应包括涡度协方差系统、自动气象站和地面观测的组合，以提供对这些复杂相互作用的全面洞察，并支持生态安全和社会经济发展。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the common challenges faced in collecting reliable data from oasis-desert systems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对从绿洲-沙漠系统中收集可靠数据所面临的常见挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Common challenges in collecting data from oasis-desert systems include the degradation of ecological environments, such as drying rivers, vegetation degradation, and desertification. These challenges are compounded by the need for long-term and multiscale observations to understand energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, which are crucial for maintaining ecological stability and supporting sustainable development in these regions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在收集绿洲-沙漠系统的数据时，常见的挑战包括生态环境的退化，如河流干涸、植被退化和沙漠化。这些挑战因需要进行长期和多尺度的观测而加剧，以理解能量、水蒸气和碳的交换，这对维持生态稳定和支持这些地区的可持续发展至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how data from hydrometeorological observations are processed and quality controlled.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解水文气象观测数据是如何处理和质量控制的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data from hydrometeorological observations are processed and quality controlled through stages of sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and dataset generation. Observational data are carefully quality controlled using synchronical ground measurements, and datasets are made available for further research, as exemplified by the HiWATER observation system and the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 水文气象观测数据通过传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成等阶段进行处理和质量控制。观测数据通过同步的地面测量进行仔细的质量控制，数据集可供进一步研究使用，例子包括HiWATER观测系统和国家西藏高原数据中心。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore and summarize the data collection methods utilized for capturing eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces, highlighting any instrumentation used on hierarchically nested scales.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨并总结用于捕捉异质表面生态水文过程的数据收集方法，重点介绍在分层嵌套尺度上使用的任何仪器。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods for capturing eco-hydrological processes involve the use of instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales. Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were conducted. Instruments were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. A sparse network was established to investigate oasis-desert interactions, with a superstation constructed within the oasis, and additional stations including EC towers and automatic meteorological stations in surrounding landscapes like sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 生态水文过程的数据收集方法涉及在层次嵌套的尺度上使用仪器。进行了几次密集观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度布置，以捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程。建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用，在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在周围的景观中设置了额外的站点，包括生态系统（EC）塔和自动气象站，覆盖沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地等区域。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please conduct a search for datasets related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems and summarize the types of data available.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请搜索与绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换相关的数据集，并总结可用的数据类型。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Datasets related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems include long-term observational data from both natural and artificial systems. The data consist of energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, hydrometeorological data (such as radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles), air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. Vegetation and soil parameters are also included. These datasets are freely available at platforms like the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 与绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换相关的数据集包括来自自然和人工系统的长期观测数据。这些数据包括能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，水文气象数据（如辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面）、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面。还包括植被和土壤参数。这些数据集可以在国家西藏高原数据中心等平台上免费获取。
